param.name: XC_P01
param.value: User selected not to delete contents of repository

param.name: XC_P01
param.value: User selected to delete contents of repository

DOCU_Docu.DOC:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_INFORMATICA_POWERCENTER.PUB.ACTION.RESTORE_REPOSITORY
= General description = This action is used to restore a repository to the specified content from a backup file.
If you just provide the backup file without complete path, it will look the specified backup file in the default backup directory. To view the default backup directory, please follow the below steps. 1.Login to Admin Console 2.Go to General Properties of Node 3.See the value of Backup Directory Usually it is set as {INFA_HOME}/server/infa_shared/Backup.
Change Mode Behaviour: * If action ends successfully and Switch to normal mode is specified as "Yes". It will change the repository mode to Normal. * If restore doesn't end successfully and Switch to normal mode is specified as "Yes/No". It will change the repository mode to Original state. * If delete content is specified as "Yes" and content has been deleted but restore has been failed. It will change the repository mode to Exclusive state.
= NOTE = * If user provides both or doesn't provide any of these : Password and Password environment variable the action will fail. This doesn't apply in Kerberos mode. * If input file name is provided without extension the command searches for a file with .rep extension. * If the backup file provided is invalid then we have the following msg in Job report: PLEASE CHECK IF SPECIFIED BACKUP FILE EXISTS ON INFORMATICA POWERCENTER SERVER AND IS VALID.
= Failure Conditions = (none)
= Inputs = * PMREP path : Specify the directory where the PMREP executable is located. E.g. C:\informatica\9.5.1.HF1_Informatica_cmd_utilities_win32-x86\PowerCenter\server\bin * Repository name : Specify repository name to which you want to connect. E.g. myrepository * Domain name : Specify domain name for the repository. E.g. abcdomain. Ihis information is mandatory for this action. However same can be specified in environment varaiable file as well. If you specify input it will be given precedence. * Host name : Specify host name for the repository. Specify if the gateway connectivity information in the domains.infa file is out of date. E.g. host123 or 192.168.1.25 * Port number : Specify the port number for the repository. Specify if the gateway connectivity information in the domains.infa file is out of date. E.g. 6005 * Username : Specify username for authentication. E.g. administrator * Security domain : Specify security domain that the user belongs to. Required if you use LDAP. It is case sensitive. E.g. Native * Password : Specify password for authentication. * Password environment variable : Specify password environment variable. Required if Password is not given. Eg. INFA_PM_PASSWORD * Connect without user : Select Yes if you want to connect without user in Kerberos mode. Do not provide username, security domain and password to connect in kerberos mode. Please consult the corresponding command line specification version whether it support this input or not. * Environment Variables File : Specify full path with file name of the executable batch or shell script to initialize environment variables. E.g /home/informatica/envVariable.sh. This file is usually provided for a Unix agent since we might want to set some environment variables like PATH, INFA_HOME, LD_LIBRARY_PATH, <password environment variable>, LC_ALL etc. * Input file name : Name of the repository backup file with full path. E.g. C:/Temp/MyRepository.rep, MyRepository etc. User could also provide just the file name if the file is present in default backup folder. * Restore options : Select options to restore repository. * Promote for global repository : Promotes the repository to a global repository. * Enable versioning : Enables object versioning for the repository. * Skip log files : Skips tables related to workflow and session logs during restore. * Skip deploy group history : Skips deployment group history during restore. * Skip MX data : Skips tables related to Metadata Exchange (MX) data during restore. * Skip task statistics : Skips task statistics during backup. * Create internal folder IDs : This enables to copy folders, deployment groups between the original and the restored repository. * Exit if different domain name : Exits if domain name in the binary file is different from current domain name. * Delete content : If Selected Yes, Deletes repository content before restoring. However if content is already deleted it will be silently ignored. * Switch to normal mode after restore : Specify Yes if you want to change repository mode to Normal after restoration is complete. No means it will change back the repository mode to original state. * Sudo Password : The password for the sudo command. * Options : Run using sudo password (and sudo username if specified). * Sudo Username : The username to be used for the sudo command. * Overwrite Agent : Overwrites the default agent * Overwrite Login : Overwrites the default login
= Behavior = (none)
= Return Value = (none)
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is 1 in case of failure.
= Rollback = (none)
= Logging = AE logs will be displayed in the AE report.
= Example = (none)
